## hexPath() function

Generate a SVG path data string that represents a hexagon.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function hexPath(size: number, rounding: number, precision: number): string;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

size


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

The size of the hexagon, in pixels.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

rounding


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

The amount of corner rounding, in the range \[0, `size`<!-- -->\].


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

precision


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

The floating point precision to use for numeric values.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

string

A string that can be used to define an SVG path.

## Remarks

The `size` of a hexagon is its width, measured between any two opposing corners. A hexagon with rounded corners can be drawn by passing a positive `rounding` value. The `rounding` value is proportional to the length of the hexagon's edges (the non-rounded portion), where the edge length (`size` - `rounding`<!-- -->) / 2. Therefore the `rounding` value should fall in the range \[0, `size`<!-- -->\].
